wikipedia_page.main:
Ian Noel Ridley Shield (24 December 1914 – 22 February 2005) was an English cricketer. Shield  was a left-handed batsman who bowled right-arm fast-medium.
Shield made his first-class debut for Hampshire in the 1939 County Championship against Essex. Shield played four matches for Hampshire in the 1939 season, with his final first-class match for the club coming against Sussex.
In his first-class career, Shield took only four wickets at a bowling average of 68.50, with best figures of 2/91.
Shield died on 22 February 2005.
